Great vibes, welcoming atmosphere, and live music on the weekends. Such a lovely space. A great spot for birthday dinners with a large group of friends or a date night. We'll definitely be back.

Came here during restaurant week- had a 6 pm reservation on a Monday and there were plenty of open seating so walk-ins are probably welcome. It's decorated really cute and I noticed a sign that said they have happy hour Tuesday-Saturday 5-630 which is awesome because the drinks are amazing- highly recommend the American beauty as it's light and refreshing. I got the rigatoni and my friend got the soup- both were delicious. As the main entree, we both ordered the steak and wanted it medium well- the portion was a bit on the smaller side and some of the cut meat pieces were not cooked fully cooked on one side- looked more like medium rare. The brown butter hollandaise sauce made the entree- so creamy and delicious. The strawberry mousse was perfect as well- really ended the whole dinner with the bang.

We have now gone to Sweetbriar a total of 10-15 times since our first visit when I wrote my Orginal review. This is has become our go-to restaurant in the city. From the warm atmosphere (and top notch staff) to the delicious food and drinks, this place is everything I want from a restaurant.. and more. It always has great vibes (and music), and everyone is so kind and welcoming. Our favorites things on the menu include the cornbread, the spicy mangalitsa pizza, the ribs, and the the burger. All of the starters/sides/desserts are amazing as well. Â Nothing on the menu is disappointing. We are obsessed with Sweetbriar and would highly recommend it!

I want to give 3.5 stars but since it was Christmas Day, 4 it is! Let me start by saying the food was so so delicious, the pictures do not do it justice. Except the dessert, it looked cute but was dry. But it was SO. MUCH. FOOD. It was a fixed menu for Christmas Day and we ended up taking half of it home, which was great as we had dinner for the next day. But it was just a lot of (very tasty) food, too much for two people. The service was really slow but I think it's because it was Christmas and people may have been out sick. There was only one barman making cocktails for the whole restaurant so it was taking forever. It was a nice atmosphere so I will definitely come back to try their regular menu.

First walking into Sweetbriar you are met with a cool atmosphere with a mid century modern look. I actually wished my sister and I had arrived a little before our reservation so we could get a drink in their front lounge. The menu was packed with southern soul food and American Italian dishes. We decided to share the corn bread, margarita woodfire pizza, and the hanger steak. It was the perfect amount of food. The restaurant was really packed and they had a couple of events going on so there was a little delay in our steak coming out. However, it was well worth the wait and I actually prefer the food to be coursed out. The manager still came over and explained the wait and offered another round of drinks on the house. Overall, great food, ambiance, and service!

NYC restaurant week with my family! I ordered the pasta, steak, and pear dessert! The pasta was so delicious as well. I was hit hesitant with the egg in it, but when you mix it with the sauce, it was the perfect combination. The presentation of the salmon was beautiful, but I liked the steak more! The steak was cooked perfectly and the sauce was good, but a little salty. The pear dessert was so big, like a mini pizza. I couldn't even finish my dessert because I was so full. It was delicious and I can't wait to go back!

We came here to celebrate my birthday. We're not much wine drinkers, so we came here mainly to eat. Not a ton of hearty food options but we ended up going with a pizza to share, corn bread, and wedges. Wedges were delicious, and the pizza was pretty tasty as well. The frustrating part was that we ordered drinks before even placing our food order, and it wasn't until we finished out ENTIRE meal that the waiter came to tell us "Oh, it looks like the bartender is behind on making drinks..." He didn't offer us an alternative and frankly didn't know what I was supposed to do with that information. He later asked if we wanted wine, which we denied because we're not wine drinkers. Eventually he came back and offered us complimentary champagne. And ironically right when we were about to leave our drink order arrived (we weren't charged for this either.) I'm glad it was no charge because I really did not enjoy the drinks at all. We probably won't be returning here.

Everything that came out was so decadent and savory- I particularly enjoyed the turnip appetizer and truffle potatoes. The ham was excellent too. Would recommend for a special occasion.

Absolutely delicious. Every drink every dish was excellent. We ordered brussle sprouts, Â radish carpaccio, hanger steak, smoked chicken, and triple chocolate moose cake. 10/10 I would recommend.

I ate at this restaurant yesterday were do i start first, the atmosphere is everything the place is a real VIBE !!!! loved the decor very adult like, our host Chris King was the absolutely the best ever. He made there dining and experience. He was very knowledgeable when it came to the food and drinks. The drinks were great & the food was chef's kiss. I ordered the corn bread a must order it doesn't disappoint, the fried bussell sprouts , the ribs melt in your mouth good. the potato wedges crispy and hot an d favorful. My honey ordered the burger tender and juicy was his words . Â Great place for date night and picture taking . Overall the staff was great . will be returning soon!!!!

Cozy sweet spot that has definitely gotten the attention of me and my friends. The most memorable dishes would be the russet potato wedges, the smoked black pepper maple Ribs and the amazing grilled maitake mushroom. The sweet soppressata pizza was my choice (compared to the wild mushroom) for the slices of ham were very enjoyable. The chicken & clams wasn't a memorable dish, and we could have done without it. Highly recommend the memorable dishes listed above and personally would return for many years to come. Great addition to NYC.
The burger and the drinks were awesome. Nice ambience. Service indifferent like rest of NYC these days.

Full disclosure- we're staying at the hotel, and brought ONE corona from our room...while my husband ordered a top shelf drink from the bar. Mathew made derogatory comments to other patrons that we were visiting from out of state, and told us to get the hell out of "his place". Â My party arrived without reservations and instead of the standard NYC arrogant response that there was a four hour wait - Sweetbriar said let's see Â if we can fit you in - mind you it was busy. Â And they did. Â Then the meats are succulent. Â I had the maple pepper ribs which was a flavor bomb. Â Add some wine and I was feeling pretty sweet.
Meal for about 16 people was excellent. Â The sautÃ©ed spinach was especially good. Service was fine and likely helped by the fact we had preordered.

I asked for 2 beers on draught and both were out. The bartender was super kind about it, but I certainly must have been ordering the wrong thing (not a spot for beer). The inside is sleek, connected to a hotel, and surprisingly charming. Classy spot for the neighborhood for sure. Food smelled good, no complaints overall - easy enough to find a seat at the bar after work on a Thursday (can't always be said)

Just went to sweetbriar for a second time and again we had an amazing dinner. Â The cocktails, food, service and ambience are all top notch. Â I'm so happy this neighborhood has as restaurant at this caliber (the Chinese and Indian take out places are good for a weeknight here and there but come on let's have a little more diversity of cuisine in rose hill). Â This time around I got the hangar steak and it was delicious. Â The mushroom pizza was phenomenal, the ice cream Sunday to die for. Â The roasted shishito peppers delicious, ribs were amazing and the potato wedges top notch. Â I love the wood fire cooking and the restaurant just has that wonderful fireplace smell. This is our neighborhood joint for sure. Â I could eat there over and over again.
Absolutely incredible experience. Wonderful bar-room staff. Wonderful dining-room staff. Deep, beautifully developed food flavors and textures.

I found this place on instagram. This place is better than I imagined! The hostess was extremely accommodating. The drinks were incredible as was the food! The food was fresh and every selection ordered, was beyond amazing! I'm looking forward to coming back to try more on the menu! This was an experience

The food here was outstanding. Â The salad, pizza, pasta and cornbread all top notch. Â The hangar steak was tasty but a small portion for the price. Â The kitchen seemed overwhelmed and 2 of our dishes never came out. Â The waiter removed them from the check and blamed the kitchen on the mistake.

Delicious food! Creative choices...all very good. Great service with very helpful suggestions. Nice ambiance. Not noisy.

We stayed at the hotel upstairs and came to eat dinner here because we found an opening and it was a phenomenal decision. We opted for the Smoked Black Pepper Maple Duroc ribs and a side of cornbread and russet potato wedges to start. Mouth watering to say the least. The service was phenomenal and our server Rinor was knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive. We actually stopped by the lounge on the way out for some additional cocktails and they were perfect. Highly recommend this place.

I would probably give this 3.5 stars but didnt want to round down. I checked out the menu before coming and was excited to try this place out. The service was okay and the food good but I didn't walk away thinking it was spectacular I would come back again. There was a mixed age crowd but seemed like alot older patrons. Â We sat at the bar. I was going to order wine but their optiond by the glass Â and bottle was a bit all over the place with very limited options. The limited bottles also had price range from $50-$400 so not many options in an affordable price range. However, the smoking pistolas cocktail I did order was perfection. The beet said was delightful with a tumeric yogurt sauce so very colorful. The sweet and spicy chicken wings had a bit too much sauce and came whole instead of as flats and drums. So definitely alot messier to eat but the bartender did provide moist towelettes to wash our face and hands. Last, we shared the Mangalista ham pizza which had a fluffy crispy crust and tasty ham but no cheese so that was a bit of a bummer. I think this place is still trying to find its groove so maybe it will come together in the future.

The second night we split a pizza and it was thin and light. Service overall was nice. Sitting at the countertop is super cool as you can watch the kitchen work.
Took 2 hours to cook 3 pizza while more servers in the room than customers. The manager had to serve food herself. Server been avoiding us playing peekaboo. That game can only last so long.

Very good food & excellent staff. All of the hosts are super cute and fun to talk to. Interior is so cute, photoshoot opp approved. If you stop in the Potato Wedges with chive Aoli are to die for. My new crack sauce.

I've been familiar with Bryce Shuman's culinary delights for the past 2yrs with his "Ribs N' Rose" delivery during the pandemic. Â I'm thrilled he has opened his own restaurant! Â With my past experience with him, I knew he'd have a hit on his hands. Â The venue itself is gorgeous and his menu is outstanding. Â The restaurant is a huge, chic, & modern space with brick, light wood, beige and green color palette. Â Upon entering there is a cozy front bar, lounge area which is great to chill with one of their amazing cocktail concoctions. Â Then past the friendly hostess stand is the larger, gorgeous bar with ample seating around 3 sides. Â The next area is the large, gorgeous dining area and the open kitchen. Â The tables are far enough apart and the staff is masked up, for those covid conscious, as I am. Â The entire staff is professional, personable, and on point with impeccable service. Â I brought my friend to celebrate her birthday and she said she felt very VIP! Â The delicious drinks came quickly and the food was absolutely delicious. Â We ordered chicken wings, brick oven kale & olive pizza, radicchio salad, and of course, the ribs and cornbread. Â Everything was presented beautifully and cooked to perfection. Â It was well worth the wait to have Bryce's food served properly in a restaurant instead of takeout (although his takeout was pretty great). Â I HIGHLY recommend a fabulous dining experience here! Â You will not be disappointed!

From the bar in the front, to the food in the back, Sweetbriar is fantastic! Â It's a cozy restaurant that combines an old-school New York family-owned feel with updated gastro-pub style food that's worthy of praise on its own. Â Friendly staff, fast service, and good eats make Sweetbriar a place you'll definitely want to put on your list!

I was a big fan of Ribs and Riesling and am happy to see Chef Shuman leading the kitchen in a new venture. The food is excellent as usual, ribs of course it goes without saying. But I really enjoyed unique dishes like the cabbage and grapes starter too (eat all the grapes, people!). Lastly they really got it right with the decor, which feels classy without being stuffy; warm ambient lighting, Heath appetizer plates, cool flatware. You could come here dressed up or down without feeling out of place. Quiet, prompt service. (The only thing I didn't love was the dessert, which had rosemary in it. Still pretty good.) You'd never know they just kicked off last month. Complements to the chef and team, I hope you thrive!

Loved this place! Came here on a Thursday evening and the place was packed. Minimalist, laid-back vibe with open kitchen. Pretty much everything we tried was delicious. Stand outs were the maitake mushroom, ribs duroc, and the crispy romanesco.

Bar area has a great atmosphere drinks are delicious. The pizza, cheddar dip and corn bread were amazing definitely recommend them. We then got the salmon and ribs, wouldn't recommend either. My partner felt sick after the salmon and my ribs were extremely tough.

Chef Bryce and crew are wonderful! My husband and I really enjoyed a tasting of many dishes- pickled romanesco, pizza, ribs, and cornbread. Â Each dish is fantastic. Chef Bryce pizza dough is so light and delicious-- like nothing we have ever had. Â The cocktails were wonderful too! Â We'll definitely be back! Great neighborhood spot!

Visited this new Restaurant a week after its opening. This New American restaurant is located in the Nomad neighborhood. The Food was just as described truly excellent comfort food. The short ribs and corn bread were amazing. Wine by the glass was very good and my partner had the pistola cocktail which was delicious. Service was very good and would definitely be back.
Incredible experience all around. The food, the service and the ambiance are everything you are looking for. We will definitely be back and soon!

This place is great. Â  The setting is beautiful and inviting, the staff is helpful and friendly,.. and then the food! Â The chef has a great track record and doesn't disappoint. Â The ribs are fabulous but so too is the cole slaw that comes with it. Â  The raddichio and cauliflower reinvent their namesakes and are just delicious. Â The pretzel crisps have a delightful spicy sauce that's hard to stop eating. Â The pizza is luscious. Â  And the list goes on. Â I can't wait to try everything. Â Hope to see you there!

Vibrant atmosphere without being overwhelming, just perfect for a relaxed dinner with family and friends. The servers were very attentive always filling our water glasses. The food was amazing, from the pickled-fried cauliflower to the squash soup with creme fraiche. The pizza was a hit, too. The chocolate mousse with peanut butter is light and not too sweet, one of the best deserts I have had, totally recommend this place. It has definitely made my top choice of NYC dining.

Not often do I feel compelled to write a review on Yelp but I had such an incredible visit I felt it necessary. The food was exceptional- I recommend the ahi tuna crudo and the grilled short ribs. It has been such a taxing year, coming to Sweetbriar for the night felt like I was living in pre-pandemic New York again. Our servers were gracious, patient (I'm slow when reading menus) and kind. I will most definitely be coming back.

What an incredible restaurant! Everything we ate was spectacular! The romanesco was one of the most delicious dishes ever! The chicken was amazing as was the pizza! The caramel apple pie pizza was fantastic and rounded off a great night of eating. Highly recommend!!

I was extremely excited for the opening of Sweetbriar because I had Bryce Shuman's food at Niche Niche and absolutely loved it. The food at Sweetbriar didn't disappoint-- it was exactly what I was hoping for. The ribs were delicious and the meat Â right off the bone. I love the coleslaw with apples. The cornbread is one of my favorite parts. The ambiance of the place is quite nice as well. The one part of my experience that bothered me was the service. We were seated 30 min after our reservation time. They had us sit by the bar waiting and then asked us to move just as we ordered drinks so they could move the two people at our table out there. Living in NYC neither of these things bothered me, but the moment they came to show up to our table the first thing the hostess said, rather than apologizing, was that we would only have the table for 90min. You'd think if they had already made us wait for so long and move around, that wouldn't be the first thing they say to you.

Was craving Taiwanese breakfast so came here and did the 2 people $35 set. It included a radish cake, fan Tuan, scallion egg pancake and soy milk. I liked how the sweet soy milk wasn't too sweet and the savory one was very filling as well. The fantuan only had pork floss and youtiao, wasn't anything spectacular and the radish cake wasn't good. The scallion egg pancake was okay, I liked the dipping sauce but overall not very impressed by this spot!

I'm from Austin, TX and we don't have too many options for Taiwanese breakfast in the area, so I had to have some while in NYC. The restaurant is tiny, fits about 6-7 people. Luckily there was an empty table for two, as we came here on one of the coldest days of the year. We got the breakfast set for two. We both got sweet soy milk (hot), and it was perfect for the weather. The soy milk was sweetened just slightly and tasted fresh. The fan tuan came out next. My only gripe with it is that I wish it had more preserved veggies in it. Otherwise, the rice was perfectly sticky and chewy, and the you tiao added a nice crunchy texture. The radish cake was my favorite part of the set. I wanted more! The scallion pancake was also pretty good. I liked the spicy sauce that it came with. All in all, I think Ho Foods did Taiwanese breakfast justice.

Visited this legendary Taiwanese beef noodle shop in Brooklyn right before it closed and it lived up to all the hype and then some! Their "red" beef noodle soup was quite flavorful and their Zha Jia Mien was delicious, as well as interestingly also being served with sliced cherry tomatoes. The scallion pancakes with egg wrapped within was also off the hook - hot and crispy, with a side of a peanut dipping sauce that was the bomb and also extremely good. You can also order Taiwanese beverages like Apple Sidra, soy milk and Taiwan Beer. A must-visit if you are ever in NYC and want to experience the best Taiwanese noodles!

My girlfriend asked to eat Taiwanese breakfast and I'm very glad I found this spot. It's authentic and delicious, but not great during colder months since you have to dine outside. If you don't want to sit outside, they appeared to be very good with takeout orders, so I would opt for that option.

This is a decent Taiwanese breakfast place, but I will say it's a far cry from traditional Taiwanese breakfast. The radish cake and hot soy milk are fantastic, but the fan tuan doesn't have enough pickled veggies in it for my preference and a little too much youtiao. The scallion egg pancake is good and the whole breakfast set for 2 is a decent amount of food for the price. The space itself is a bit cramped but I don't mind it personally. Service is fine, nothing special and some of the staff seem to not want to be there.

A bit of disappointment from the food. Didn't have any expectations and came out being more disappointed. Services were great but the food was lacking. We got the combo, jiajiang noodle and the sesame noodle and almost everything came out overly salty. The appetizer, pickle, looked nice but tasted like eating salt. Once I put into my mouth, I had to stop and went to grab some rice. The noodle, both jiajiang and sesame, caught me off guard. Noodle stick together, the sauce didn't mix well into the noodle and still tasted salty. The only thing I like was their Lou ro rice. Nice egg presentation and the tiny strip size pork belly was very tasty with the rice.

Love this restaurant a lot! I often stop by for the pork rice and get a dessert from jell&chill next door(sadly it's closed) Nothing to complain about the food, authentic taste and nice service. But tbh it's overpriced. In general, highly recommended!

The sweet soy milk is good too but not as unique as the savory version. Other dishes I've tried are just okay. The beef noodle soup had oustanding soup base but the noodles were a little overcooked. Delicious beef noodle soup, great service, and safe outdoor seating arrangement during Covid. I wouldn't hesitate to make a breakfast or dinner reservation on Resy.

Ho Foods is a small Taiwanese restaurant nestled in the East Village. We ordered the Chili Wontons to share which were just the right balance of spice and savory. Each of us stuck to the iconic Beef Noodle Soup for our main dish. The soup was simply perfect. The meat was tender and the broth was delectable. We will definitely be back soon.
